intro: Symphonia eugenioides, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and aromatic properties. The plant has elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and produces small, yellowish flowers followed by orange-red fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its high value in the musical instrument industry, it is also considered an endangered species.
